explanations.A: This is the area of pizza required for the 15 people, the final step to find the number of pizzas is to divide by how much area each person will eat...
explanations.B: I think you have found the perimeter of the pizza instead of the area.. Remember to find the area do base x width!
explanations.C: I think you correctly worked out the number of pizzas but then rounded down, this means there won't be enough pizza for everyone! You need to round up...
explanations.D: To find the number of pizzas, we first work out the amount of pizza we need to feed 15 people. 15 x 300cm² = 4500cm². Next, find area of the pizza 26 x 45 = 1170cm². Finally, we divide 4500 by 1170 to determine how many pizzas we will need. 4500 ÷ 1170 = 3.8. We can't cook 0.8 of a pizza therefore we need to make 4 so there is enough for everyone!
